meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of ectotrophy.
meanings.sent1: The ectotrophic plants rely on external sources for nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The ectotrophic fungi form symbiotic relationships with trees.
meanings.sent3: The ectotrophic mushrooms threw a party for the underground fungi.
meanings.sent4: Her ectotrophic nature shone brightly in the forest of competition.
meanings.sent5: The ectotrophic behavior of the vines was like a dance with the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The ectotrophic organism thrived in the open air.
meanings.sent2: The ectotrophic roots spread wide to absorb nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The ectotrophic bird built its nest high in the tree for a better view.
meanings.sent4: His ectotrophic approach to problem-solving was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The ectotrophic leaves fluttered in the breeze, embracing the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The ectotrophic process of nutrient absorption was fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The ectotrophic nature of the ecosystem supported diverse life forms.
meanings.sent3: The ectotrophic expedition into the forest was full of surprises.
meanings.sent4: Her ectotrophic journey through life was filled with external influences.
meanings.sent5: The ectotrophic relationship between the plant and the soil was delicate yet vital.
